result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Total credit of 135 days for both counts.
Consecutive to: Count 2.

Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.    Absolute sobriety.  Must take all prescribed medications.  Do not possess firearms.

Defendant Daniel J Collins in court with attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak.  Defendant Daniel J Collins in custody.  Danuta E. Kurczewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to the competency evaluation.  State waives their right to provide any additional information regarding competency.  Court finds that the defendant is competent.  

Attorney Nolan-Plutchak makes a motion to amend bond and have the signature bond reinstated.  Attorney Kurczewski makes a statement.  Court reinstates the $2500 signature bond with the conditions of absolute sobriety and do not possess weapons or firearms and take all prescribed medications and do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell alcohol.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
ad Prosequendum

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel J Collins in court with attorney Emily M. Nolan-Plutchak.  Defendant Daniel J Collins in custody.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant stipulates to the doctor's report in this matter. Court questions the defendant who states that he agrees that he is not competent to proceed.  

Court finds that defendant is incompetent to proceed and finds that he may regain competence.  Court finds that defendant be held in a confined setting and that the appropriate drugs will be administered.  The proceedings are suspended.  Court finds that he may become competent within a one year period.  Court finds that defendant is entitled to 7 days of credit.  

Attorney Nolan-Plutchak addresses bond. Requests that the Court reinstate the signature bond.  Attorney Kenas makes a statement.  Court orders that bond will remain the same.
fax cover sheet from Wisconsin Forensic Unit
Competency hearing at 12-07-2015 02:00 pm
Absolute sobriety.  Do not possess firearms. Take all prescribed medications.

Defendant Daniel J Collins in court with attorney Emily M. Nolan-Plutchak.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  A Competency Report has been conducted.  Defendant will not stipulate to the report and wishes to have another doctor to an evaluation.  Attorney Nolan-Plutchak states that is his client's wishes.  Attorney Nolan-Plutchak is requesting an adjournment to have time to have another competency evaluation done.   Court will adjourn.  Attorney Kenas addresses bond and advises the Court of a conversation she had with Dr. Galli regarding the potential dangerousness of the defendant and requests a cash bond.  Attorney Nolan-Plutchak states that she will not stipulate to the doctor's report.  Court will take judicial notice of the report.  Attorney Nolan-Plutchak makes a statement regarding bond.  

Court sets bond at $2500 cash with the condition that he must not possess any firearms and he must take all prescribed medications and absolute sobriety.
Competency hearing at 11-30-2015 11:45 am

Defendant Daniel J Collins in court with attorney Emily M. Nolan-Plutchak.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nolan Plutchak is requesting that a competency evaluation be conducted and makes a statement to the court.  State does not oppose.  Court will order a competency evaluation and signs the Order.
